Return to pcie_gen3: pcie_gen3 Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_CNT_CONFIG - PRBS Checker Count Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d0
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d0
Reset Value = 16'h0602
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:13 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
12:08 RW prbs_chk_ool_cnt specifies the number of consecutive valid clock cycles with 1 or more bit errors 
for PRBS checker to go out of PRBS lock state. Valid values are 0 to 31 where 
0 indicate that PRBS will go out of lock as soon as it gets the first clock cycle with 1 or more bit errors.
likewise 31 indicates that PRBS will go out of lock as soon as it gets the 32 consecutive clocks with 1 or more errors.
Reset value is 0x6.
07:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04:00 RW prbs_chk_lock_cnt specifies the number of consecutive valid clock cycles without any bit error
for PRBS checker to go into PRBS lock state. Valid values are 0 to 31 where 
0 indicate that PRBS will lock as soon as it gets the first clock cycle with no bit error.
likewise 31 indicates that PRBS will lock as soon as it gets the 32 consecutive clocks with no error.
Reset value is 0x2.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_CONFIG - PRBS Checker Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d1
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d1
Reset Value = 16'h002a
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW prbs_chk_burst_err_cnt_en PRBS checker clock enable.
     1'b1 will enable the PRBS checker clock. Recommended to be enabled before enabling the prbs_chk_en.
Reset value is 0x0.
14:12 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
11 RW prbs_chk_clk_en_frc_on PRBS checker clock enable.
     1'b1 will enable the PRBS checker clock. Recommended to be enabled before enabling the prbs_chk_en.
Reset value is 0x0.
10 RW trnsum_error_count_en Training sum error counter Mode enable.
       1 => will make the PRBS error counter used as trnsum_error counter. PRBS checker can not be used during this mode.
       0 => PRBS checker mode.
Reset value is 0x0.
09 RW prbs_chk_err_cnt_burst_mode PRBS Error Counter Mode. 
       1 => Each busrt of error will be counted as 1 error in the error counter. Each error busrt must be separated by 1 error-free cycle of data which in worst case should be 39 bits.
       0 => Each bit error will be counted.
Reset value is 0x0.
08 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
07 RW prbs_chk_en_auto_mode PRBS Checker Enable Mode Control. 
       1 => select (rx_dsc_lock & prbs_chk_en) as PRBS checker enable control.
       0 => select                prbs_chk_en  as PRBS checker enable control.
Reset value is 0x0.
06:05 RW prbs_chk_mode PRBS LOCK state machine select.  
       2'd0 -> Self-sync mode w/ hysteresis. PRBS seed register is continuously seeded with previous received bits.
               This mode results in faster locking, but bit errors are counted multiple times (often by 3x).
       2'd1 -> Initial seed mode w/ hysteresis. PRBS seed registers is seeded with previous received bits only till PRBS lock is 
               acquired and then they run locally independently from the received data until the checker goes out of PRBS lock.
       2'd2 -> Initial seed mode w/o hysteresis. Similar to mode 1 above except once locked it stays locked until PRBS is disabled.   
       2'd3 -> reserved for future use.
Reset value is 0x1.
04 RW prbs_chk_inv PRBS Invert enable.
     1 => will invert all the data bits to the PRBS checker.
     0 => will send normal data to the PRBS checker.
Reset value is 0x0.
03:01 RW prbs_chk_mode_sel PRBS checker mode select. Selects the PRBS polynomial as shown below
     3'd0 -> PRBS 7                   
     3'd1 -> PRBS 9                   
     3'd2 -> PRBS 11                  
     3'd3 -> PRBS 15                  
     3'd4 -> PRBS 23                  
     3'd5 -> PRBS 31                  
     3'd6 -> PRBS 58 (1 + x^39 + x^58)
     3'd7 -> reserved for future use. 
Reset value is 0x5.
00 RW prbs_chk_en PRBS checker enable.
     1 => enable  the PRBS checker.
     0 => disable the PRBS checker.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_DIG_LPBK_CONFIG - Digital Loopback Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d2
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d2
Reset Value = 16'h000e
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03 RW dig_lpbk_pd_bias_en 1'b1 will enable PD inc bias mode where there will be inc generated every 16th clock cycle..
1'b0 will disable the PD bias mode so inc/dec will be generated based on the PD output.
Reset value is 0x1.
02 RW dig_lpbk_pd_flt_bypass Digital Loopback Phase Detector Filter Bypass. For repeater applications, it should be 1'b1.
For other applications filter can be enabled for better jitter tolerance performance for the didgital loopback.
Reset value is 0x1.
01 RW dig_lpbk_pd_mode Digital Loopback Phase Detector Mode. For normal operating conditions keep it at the default value of 1'b1.
1'b0 - swap inc/dec. 1'b1 - normal mode.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RW dig_lpbk_en TX to RX Parallel Loopback (Digital Loopback) Enable.
     1 => Loopback is Enabled. 
     0 => Loopback is Disabled.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_TLB_RX_MISC_CONFIG - TLB RX Misc. Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d3
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d3
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW dbg_mask_dig_lpbk_en Mask bit for dig_lpbk_en in the pmd_rx_lock equation. This is a debug register.
     1 => pmd_rx_lock will be forced to 1'b0 during digital loopback.
     0 => pmd_rx_lock will be forced to 1'b1 during digital loopback.
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW rx_aggregator_bypass_en RX Aggregator Bypass Enable
      When Enabled by writing to 1'b1, DSC Data will bypass the RX Data aggregator block and sent directly to PCS along with a sync pulse which will indicate the (clk_cnt ==0).
      Recommended for use if low latency is desired and where data aggregation will be done in the PCS block based on the sync pulse.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW rx_pmd_dp_invert RX PMD Datapath Invert Control.
      When Enabled by writing to 1'b1, it will invert all the datapath bits of the logical lane.
      Recommended for use in case P and N pads are swapped on the PCB board.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_EN_TIMER_CONTROL - TLB RX PRBS Checker Enable Timer Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d4
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d4
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:13 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
12:08 RW prbs_chk_en_timeout PRBS timer timeout value.
Valid range 0 to 31 which maps to 0 to 448. Should be programmed before enabling the PRBS checker in timer mode.
Reset value is 0x0.
07:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01:00 RW prbs_chk_en_timer_mode prbs_chk_en timer mode.
     2'b0x => prbs_chk_en timer is disabled and PRBS checker mode is enabled as per prbs_chk_en register.
     2'b10 => use heartbeat_toggle_1us for the timer.
     2'b11 => use heartbeat_toggle_1ms for the timer.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_BURST_ERR_CNT_STATUS - PRBS Checker Burst Error Counter Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d5
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d5
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09:00 RO prbs_chk_burst_err_cnt PRBS Checker Burst Error Counter Status Register. It is a clear on read register. This register counts
the number of Burst in errors separated by atleast 1 clock cycle worth of data without any bit in error.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_DBG_PMD_RX_LOCK_STATUS - Debug PMD RX LOCK Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d6
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d6
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO dbg_pmd_rx_lock_change Set to 1'b1 when change/transition on PMD RX LOCK. This is a sticky bit and cleared upon read. This is a debug register.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RO dbg_pmd_rx_lock Debug PMD RX LOCK Indication. This is a live indication of the status of the pmd_rx_lock output port.
               1 => PMD is in LOCKED state and RX PCS data should have acceptable BER.         
               0 => PMD is not LOCKED yet.        
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_UC_PMD_RX_LOCK_STATUS - Debug PMD RX LOCK Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d7
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d7
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO uc_pmd_rx_lock_change Set to 1'b1 when change/transition on PMD RX LOCK. This is a sticky bit and cleared upon read. This is a debug register.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RO uc_pmd_rx_lock Debug PMD RX LOCK Indication. This is a live indication of the status of the pmd_rx_lock output port.
               1 => PMD is in LOCKED state and RX PCS data should have acceptable BER.         
               0 => PMD is not LOCKED yet.        
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_DIG_LPBK_PD_STATUS - Digital Loopback Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d8
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d8
Reset Value = 16'h0002
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO dig_lpbk_pd_early_ind 1 means dp_rclk20 is sampling data earlier so delay the dp_rclk20 clock phase. This will result in RX PI phase step increment.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RO dig_lpbk_pd_late_ind 1 means dp_rclk20 is sampling data late so reduce the delay of the dp_rclk20 clock phase. This will result in RX PI phase step decrement.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_LOCK_STATUS - PRBS Checker LOCK Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0d9
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0d9
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RO prbs_chk_err_cnt_no_clr PRBS Checker Error Counter which does not get cleared upon read.                 
  MSB bit 14 is OR of the MSB bits [30:14] of the internal error counter.        
  LSB bits [13:0] are assigned to LSB bits [13:0] of the internal error counter. 
  It can be cleared by reading the status register prbs_chk_err_cnt_msb.         
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RO prbs_chk_lock PRBS Checker LOCK Indication. This is a live indication of the status of the PRBS Checker state machine.
               1 => PRBS Checker is in LOCKED state.                                                    
               0 => PRBS Checker is out of LOCK state and state machine is searching for a LOCK.        
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_ERR_CNT_MSB_STATUS - PRBS Checker Error Counter MSB Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0da
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0da
Reset Value = 16'h8000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RO prbs_chk_lock_lost_lh PRBS Checker LOCK_LOST Latch High Indication. This register captures the 1->0 transition on the
prbs_chk_lock live status register and keep it latched until read. This is a clear on read status registers.
Reset value is 0x1.
14:00 RO prbs_chk_err_cnt_msb 15 bits MSB portion of PRBS Checker Error Counter Status Register. It is a clear on read register. 
Once MSB bits [30:16] of the counter are read then LSB bits [15:0] of the error counter is loaded 
into a holding register and internal PRBS error counter's all bits are cleared to 0s
(or if there are any error in that particular clock cycle then that will be loaded).
MSB portion must be read first before reading the LSB portion of the error counter. 
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PRBS_CHK_ERR_CNT_LSB_STATUS - PRBS Checker Error Counter LSB Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0db
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0db
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO prbs_chk_err_cnt_lsb 16 bits LSB portion of PRBS Checker Error Counter Status Register. This register indicates
the value in the holding register when MSB portion [30:16] of the error counter are read.
MSB portion must be read first before reading the LSB portion of the error counter. 
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_RX_PMD_RX_LOCK_STATUS - PMD RX LOCK Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0dc
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0dc
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO pmd_rx_lock_change Set to 1'b1 when change/transition on PMD RX LOCK. This is a sticky bit and cleared upon read.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RO pmd_rx_lock PMD RX LOCK Indication. This is a live indication of the status of the pmd_rx_lock output port.
               1 => PMD is in LOCKED state and RX PCS data should have acceptable BER.         
               0 => PMD is not LOCKED yet.        
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_RX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

Return to pcie_gen3: pcie_gen3 Table

TLB_TX_PATT_GEN_CONFIG - Pattern Generator Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0e0
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0e0
Reset Value = 16'hb000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:12 RW patt_gen_start_pos Valid values are 11 to 0. Defines the start position of the pattern in 20 bit chunks. 
11 means start at bit 239, 
10 means start at bit 219, ..., 
  0 means start at bit  19 
so start bit is (rg_patt_gen_start_pos*20 + 19).  
Reset value is 0xb.
11:08 RW patt_gen_stop_pos Valid values are 11 to 0. Defines the stop  position of the pattern in 20 bit chunks. 
This register value should be less than or equal to rg_patt_gen_start_pos.
11 means stop at bit  220, 
10 means stop at bit  200, ...,   
  0 means stop at bit    0 
so stop  bit is (rg_patt_gen_stop_pos*20).
Reset value is 0x0.
07:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW patt_gen_en Fixed pattern generator enable.
     1 => enable  the fixed pattern generator.
     0 => disable the fixed pattern generator.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_TX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_TX_PRBS_GEN_CONFIG - PRBS Generator Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0e1
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0e1
Reset Value = 16'h000a
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:06 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
05 RW prbs_gen_err_ins PRBS Error Insert.
     0 to 1 transition on this signal will insert single bit error in the MSB bit of the data bus.
Reset value is 0x0.
04 RW prbs_gen_inv PRBS Invert enable.
     1 => will invert all the data bits from the PRBS generator.
     0 => will send normal data from the PRBS generator.
Reset value is 0x0.
03:01 RW prbs_gen_mode_sel PRBS generator mode select. Selects the PRBS polynomial as shown below
     3'd0 -> PRBS 7                   
     3'd1 -> PRBS 9                   
     3'd2 -> PRBS 11                  
     3'd3 -> PRBS 15                  
     3'd4 -> PRBS 23                  
     3'd5 -> PRBS 31                  
     3'd6 -> PRBS 58 (1 + x^39 + x^58)
     3'd7 -> reserved for future use. 
Reset value is 0x5.
00 RW prbs_gen_en PRBS generator enable.
     1 => enable  the PRBS generator.
     0 => disable the PRBS generator.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_TX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_TX_RMT_LPBK_CONFIG - Remote Loopback Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0e2
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0e2
Reset Value = 16'h0002
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW rmt_lpbk_pd_frc_on Remote loopback PD enable by force irrespective of rg_rmt_lpbk_en.
1'b1 - enable the phase detector without the remote loopback enable. Can be used to lock RX and TX
clock phases when there is a remote loopback outside PMD
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW rmt_lpbk_pd_mode Remote Loopback Phase Detector Mode. For normal operating conditions keep it at the default value of 1'b1.
1'b0 - swap inc/dec. 1'b1 - normal mode.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RW rmt_lpbk_en RX to TX Parallel Loopback (Remote Loopback) Enable.
     1 => Loopback is Enabled. 
     0 => Loopback is Disabled.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_TX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_TX_TLB_TX_MISC_CONFIG - TLB TX Misc. Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0e3
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0e3
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW tx_mux_sel_order TX Data MUX Select Priority Order. When 1'b1 then priority of Pattern and PRBS generators are swapped w.r.t. CL72.
      0 => TX Data Mux select order from higher to lower priority is {rmt_lpbk, patt_gen, cl72_tx, prbs_gen, tx_pcs}.
      1 => TX Data Mux select order from higher to lower priority is {rmt_lpbk, prbs_gen, cl72_tx, patt_gen, tx_pcs}.
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW tx_pcs_native_ana_frmt_en TX PCS Interface Native Analog Format Enable.
      1 => TX PCS Interface is enabled in the Native Analog Format mode. TX PCS sends the over-sampled data in this mode which is sent directly to AFE.
      0 => Raw Data Mode where for every data request TX PCS will send 20 bits of valid data.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW tx_pmd_dp_invert TX PMD Datapath Invert Control.
      When Enabled by writing to 1'b1, it will invert all the datapath bits of the logical lane.
      Recommended for use in case P and N pads are swapped on the PCB board.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_TX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TLB_TX_RMT_LPBK_PD_STATUS - Remote Loopback Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0e8
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0e8
Reset Value = 16'h0002
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO rmt_lpbk_pd_early_ind 1 means dp_tclk20 is sampling data earlier so delay the dp_tclk20 clock phase. This will result in TX PI phase step increment.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RO rmt_lpbk_pd_late_ind 1 means dp_tclk20 is sampling data late so reduce the delay of the dp_tclk20 clock phase. This will result in TX PI phase step decrement. 
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TLB_TX: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

Return to pcie_gen3: pcie_gen3 Table

DIG_COM_REVID0 - REVID0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f0
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f0
Reset Value = 16'h0363
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:14 RO revid_rev_letter All layer revision letter
0 = revA
1 = revB
2 = revC
3 = revD
Reset value is 0.
13:11 RO revid_rev_number Metal mask revision number
Reset value is 0.
10:09 RO revid_bonding bonding
0 = wire bond
1 = flip chip
2-3 = reserved
Reset value is 1.
08:06 RO revid_process technology process
0 = 90nm
1 = 65nm
2 = 40nm
3 = 28nm
4 = 20nm
5 = 16nm
6-7 = reserved
Reset value is 5.
05:00 RO revid_model model number
Reset value is 0x23.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_RESET_CONTROL_PMD - RESET_CONTROL_PMD
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f1
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f1
Reset Value = 16'h0001
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW ana_txclk_reset_enable Enable ana_txclk_reset.
Reset value is 0x0.
14:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW core_s_rstb Active Low Core Level Soft Reset. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the whole core.
This soft reset is equivalent to the hard reset input pin pmd_por_h_rstb. This regiter bit can only be
reset by assertion of the hard reset input pin pmd_por_h_rstb
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_RESET_CONTROL_CORE_DP - RESET_CONTROL_CORE_DP
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f2
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f2
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW disable_ack_timeout Setting this bit to 1 disables the ack timeout for all ports.
Reset value is 0x0.
14:11 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
10 RW pmd_vcoclk16_vld_frc_val pmd_vcoclk16_vld pin force value.
Reset value is 0x0.
09 RW pmd_vcoclk16_vld_frc pmd_vcoclk16_vld pin force.
Reset value is 0x0.
08 RW vcoclk16_s_comclk_frc_on Mux control for selection of comclk for pmd_vcoclk16 by force.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will select the comclk for the pmd_vcoclk16 clock. This is a debug bit and should be used only for recovery from a dead AFE lane clock. Use of this bit with an active AFE clock can cause clock glitches.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_vcoclk16_vld to 1'b0 while vcoclk16_s_comclk_frc_on is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_vcoclk16_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.
07 RW vcoclk16_s_comclk_sel Mux control for selection of comclk for pmd_vcoclk16 clock.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will select the comclk for the pmd_vcoclk16 clock.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_vcoclk16_vld to 1'b0 while vcoclk16_s_comclk_sel is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_vcoclk16_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.
06 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
05 RW pmd_mdio_trans_pkill 1'b1 will disable the pmd_mdio_trans pin.
Reset value is 0x0.
04 RW sup_rst_seq_frc Suppress reset sequence force.
Reset value is 0x0.
03 RW sup_rst_seq_frc_val Suppress reset sequence.
Reset value is 0x0.
02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW pmd_core_dp_h_rstb_pkill 1'b1 will disable the pmd_core_dp_h_rstb pin.

Reset value is 0x0.
00 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_MASKDATA_REG - MASKDATA_REG
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f3
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f3
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW maskdata maskdata for writes that can be used with any PMI port (PMI_HP, PMI_LP or PMI_MDIO). This register will get reset to 0 after each transaction.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_TOP_USER_CONTROL_0 - TOP_USER_CONTROL_0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f4
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f4
Reset Value = 16'h0190
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW uc_active When set to 1'b1 then Hardware should wait for uC handshakes to wake up from datapath reset
When set to 1'b0 then Hardware can internally assume that uc_ack_* = 1.
Reset value is 0x0.
14 RW afe_s_pll_pwrdn Active High PLL Power Down control.
Reset value is 0x0.
13 RW core_dp_s_rstb Active Low Core Level Datapath Soft Reset. If asserted by writing
to 1'b0 will reset datapath logic of all the lanes. This soft reset
is equivalent to the hard reset input pin core_dp_h_rstb.
Reset value is 0x0.
12 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
11:10 RW maskdata_bus_assign This 2-bit register is used to assign the maskdata bus to any port .
00: maskdata register is assigned to MDIO port 
01: maskdata register is assigned to PMI_HP port 
10: maskdata register is assigned to PMI_LP port 
11: maskdata register is not assigned to any port 
Reset value is 0x0.
09:00 RW heartbeat_count_1us Heartbeat timer count in comclk cycles to create 1us heartbeat_1us period. It should be programmed to the nearest increment of 0.25Mhz value of the comclk frequency in Mhz.
For example, for comclk of 125 Mhz, it should be programmed to 10'd500. For 156.25 Mhz comclk, it should be programmed to 10'd625 and similarly for any other comclk frequency. 
Reset value is 0x190.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_UC_ACK_CORE_CONTROL - UC_ACK_CORE_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f5
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f5
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 SC uc_ack_core_dp_reset uC will write this to 1 to acknowledge a reset event after seeing "core_dp_reset_coccured".
Reset value is 0x0.
00 SC uc_ack_core_cfg_done uC will write this to 1 to indicate it's configuration of the core is complete. Writing to 1'b1 will 
should release internal hold on core_dp_reset, only if core_dp_reset_state is 3'b001.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_CORE_REG_RESET_OCCURRED_CONTROL - CORE_REG_RESET_OCCURRED_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f6
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f6
Reset Value = 16'h0001
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW core_reg_reset_occurred Set to 1'b1 upon core level register reset and remains so until cleared by register write from uC.
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_RST_SEQ_TIMER_CONTROL - RST_SEQ_TIMER_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f7
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f7
Reset Value = 16'h86f0
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:14 RW rst_seq_dis_flt_mode Defines the filter mode for rst_seq_dis/pmd_mdio_trans pin.  
  2'd0 - filter is bypassed where input is passed to output untouched.
  2'd1 - filter output is 16 comclk cycles if input is > 16 comclk cycles else output is same as input signal. 
  2'd2 - filter output is 20 comclk cycles if input is > 20 comclk cycles else output is same as input signal. 
  2'd3 - filter output is 24 comclk cycles if input is > 24 comclk cycles else output is same as input signal. 
Reset value is 0x2.
13:12 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
11:09 RW pwrdn_seq_timer Defines the number of comclk cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane pwrdn and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. 
Valid value range is from 0 to 7 which will provide from 8 to 64 clock cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane pwrdn
and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. Wait_time = 8 * (pwrdn_seq_timer + 1).
Reset value is 0x3.
08:06 RW dsc_pwrdn_seq_timer Defines the number of comclk cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane pwrdn and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. 
Valid value range is from 0 to 7 which will provide from 8 to 64 clock cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane pwrdn
and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. Wait_time = 8 * (pwrdn_seq_timer + 1).
Reset value is 0x3.
05:03 RW dsc_rst_seq_timer Defines the number of comclk cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane reset and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. 
Valid value range is from 0 to 7 which will provide from 1 to 15 clock cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane reset
and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. Wait_time = 2 * rst_seq_timer + 1.
Reset value is 0x6.
02:00 RW rst_seq_timer Defines the number of comclk cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane reset and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. 
Valid value range is from 0 to 7 which will provide from 1 to 15 clock cycles between de-assertion of AFE RX/TX lane reset
and clock muxing from comclk to lane clock. Wait_time = 2 * rst_seq_timer + 1.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_CORE_DP_RESET_STATE_STATUS - CORE_DP_RESET_STATE_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f8
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f8
Reset Value = 16'h0007
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RO tx_lane_reset_released indicates if a lane is currently at {tx_lane_dp_reset_active, tx_lane_dp_reset_occurred} = 01.
Reset value is 0x0.
14 RO lane_reset_released indicates if a lane is currently at {rx_lane_dp_reset_active, rx_lane_dp_reset_occurred} = 01.
Reset value is 0x0.
13 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
12:08 RO lane_reset_released_index Index of the lane number of the first RX lane in lane_reset_released state.
Reset value is 0x0.
07:03 RO tx_lane_reset_released_index Index of the lane number of the first TX lane in lane_reset_released state.
Reset value is 0x0.
02:00 RO core_dp_reset_state Bit 2: core_dp_reset_active   : Set to 1'b1 whenenver core_dp_reset is currently requested through any register or pin controls. 
Bit 1: core_dp_reset_occurred : Set to 1'b1 whenenver core_dp_reset is currently requested through any register or pin controls and is latched high. 
Bit 0: core_dp_reset_held     : Set to 1'b1 whenenver core_dp_reset is internally held. Cleared to 1'b0, only if core_dp_reset_state==001 and uc_ack_core_cfg_done == 1.
Reset value is 0x7.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_PMD_CORE_MODE_STATUS - PMD_CORE_MODE_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0f9
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0f9
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO pmd_core_mode This indicates the status of the core input pin pmd_core_mode. 
This is driven from PCS and used for communication between PCS and PMD Micro code.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

DIG_COM_REVID2 - REVID2
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d0fe
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d0fe
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03:00 RO revid2 Revision ID2 code
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to DIG_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PATT_GEN_COM_SEQ_12 - Pattern Generator Sequence Word 12

Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW patt_gen_seq_12 Fixed Pattern Generator Sequence Word 12. MSB bits will be transmitted first on serial transmit lane in both shared and slice mode.
Reset value is 0xff00.

Return to PATT_GEN_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PATT_GEN_COM_SEQ_13 - Pattern Generator Sequence Word 13
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d10d
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d10d
Reset Value = 16'hff00
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW patt_gen_seq_13 Fixed Pattern Generator Sequence Word 13. MSB bits will be transmitted first on serial transmit lane in both shared and slice mode.
Reset value is 0xff00.

Return to PATT_GEN_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PATT_GEN_COM_SEQ_14 - Pattern Generator Sequence Word 14
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d10e
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d10e
Reset Value = 16'hff00
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW patt_gen_seq_14 Fixed Pattern Generator Sequence Word 14. MSB bits will be transmitted first on serial transmit lane in both shared and slice mode. This word will be transmitted first.
Reset value is 0xff00.

Return to PATT_GEN_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

TX_FED_TXFIR_TAP_CONTROL0 - TX FIR TAP Control0 Register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d110
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d110
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03:00 RW txfir_post2 tx fir post2 tap override value (binary)
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TX_FED: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_FED_MISC_CONTROL0 - Misc Control0 Register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d111
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d111
Reset Value = 16'h0020
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06 RW convert_taps_to_afe_error Conversion Error
Micro sets this field to 1'b1 to indicates that the conversion is not 
performed because the binary taps values do not meet the constraints
It is the responsibility of the API code to ensure taps meet the  
constraints
Reset value is 0.
05 RW convert_taps_to_afe_int_en Conversion Interrupt Enable
When this field is set to 1'b1, then settin the 
convert_txfir_taps_to_afe field  to 1'b1 generates an
interrupt to the micro
1 - enabled,  0 - disabled
Reset value is 1.
04 RW convert_taps_to_afe Convert txfir binary tap values to afe interface signals
API codes writes a value of 1'b1 to start the conversion
Micro writes a value of 1'b0 to indicate that the conversion is done
It is the responsibilty of the API code to set the correct
pre/main/post1 (in cl72 register block) and post2 values before 
setting this field 
Reset value is 0.
03:02 RW tx_disable_output_sel These bits select tx disable output function
2'b00 - send electrical idles
2'b01 - send power down
2'b10 - send ones
2'b11 - send zeroes
Reset value is 0.
01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW sdk_tx_disable sdk tx disable
This tx disable control field is for SDK use during TX programming
Please see Eagle & Merlin PMD Internal Functional Specification for details
Reset value is 0.

Return to TX_FED: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_FED_MISC_STATUS0 - Misc Status 0 Register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d112
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d112
Reset Value = 16'h0003
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO tx_elec_idle_status tx electrical idle status
When this bit is set it indicates the tx elecrticl idle active due to:
1) tx disable being programmed to send electrical idles or
2) An internal logic signal derived from PMD interface pins for EEE TX MODE
Reset value is 1.
00 RO tx_disable_status tx disable status
When this bit is set it indicates the tx_disable is active due to:
1) pin at AN/PCS to PMD Interface OR
2) dp_reset being asserted
3) register bit dedicated to micro use
4) register bit dedicated to SDK use
5) tx disable timer that guarntees minimum assertion time has not expired
Reset value is 1.

Return to TX_FED: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_FED_MICRO_CONTROL0 - Micro Control0 Register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d113
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d113
Reset Value = 16'hc160
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW tx_eee_alert_en Tx eee alert mode control
1 - Enable eee alert mode when pmd_tx_mode (input pins) == 2'b10
0 - Disable eee alert mode
Reset value is 1.
14 RW tx_eee_quiet_en Tx eee quiet mode control
1 - Enable eee quiet mode when pmd_tx_mode (input pins) == 2'b01
0 - Disable eee quiet mode
Reset value is 1.
13:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09:04 RW tx_disable_timer_ctrl tx_disable timer value controls
tx_disable_timer_ctrl[5] (MSB) selects the timer units
0 - 2us units
1 - 1ms units

tx_disable_timer_ctrl[4:0] (LSB[4:0]) = controls the number of units per
the list below
0                 0 units 
1                 1 units 
2                 2 units 
3                 3 units 
4                 4 units 
5                 5 units 
6                 6 units 
7                 7 units 
8                 8 units 
9                10 units 
10               12 units 
11               14 units 
12               16 units 
13               20 units 
14               24 units 
15               28 units 
16               32 units 
17               40 units 
18               48 units 
19               56 units 
20               64 units 
21               80 units 
22               96 units 
23              112 units 
24              128 units 
25              160 units 
26              192 units 
27              224 units 
28              256 units 
29              320 units 
30              384 units 
31              448 units 
Reset value is 0x16.
03 RW pmd_tx_disable_pkill Tx disable using the pmd_tx_disable pin disable control
0 - enable tx disable from pmd_tx_disable pin
1 - disable tx disable from pmd_tx_disable pin
Reset value is 0.
02 RW dp_reset_tx_disable_dis Tx disable based on data path reset
0 - Enable tx disable based on data path reset
1 - Disable tx disable based on data path reset
     Need to set this bit to 1 if tx_disable_output_sel = 2'b01 (send TX power down).
Reset value is 0.
01 SC tx_disable_trigger Tx disable trigger
When this bit is set to 1, it triggers a TX disable with timer starting at 0.
No matter where the TX disable state is, it start a new timer and apply TX disable.
This bit is self clearing
Reset value is 0.
00 RW micro_tx_disable micro tx disable
This field is used by the Microcontroller for tx disable control during CL72 forced mode
Please see Eagle & Merlin PMD Internal Functional Specification for details
Reset value is 0.

Return to TX_FED: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

maps to i_txk_fir_post2_post2[2] pin on m16 afe

PLL_CAL_COM_CTL_0 - PLL_CAL_CTL_0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d120
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d120
Reset Value = 16'h0100
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:14 RW cal_th programmable PLL calibration threshold for best, typical and worst case
Reset value is 0x0.
13 RW pll_cal_jump_ena when asserted will allow CALIB SM to jump tuning states for faster lock
Reset value is 0x0.
12:00 RW calib_step_time The number of divided vco/ref calibration clocks to wait after the pll range has been changed
Reset value is 0x100.

Return to PLL_CAL_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PLL_CAL_COM_CTL_1 - PLL_CAL_CTL_1
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d121
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d121
Reset Value = 16'hfff0
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW freqdet_time ref/vco counter terminal value in lockdet module
Reset value is 0xfff0.

Return to PLL_CAL_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PLL_CAL_COM_CTL_2 - PLL_CAL_CTL_2
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d122
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d122
Reset Value = 16'h01ff
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription

Reset value is 0x1ff.

Return to PLL_CAL_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PLL_CAL_COM_CTL_3 - PLL_CAL_CTL_3
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d123
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d123
Reset Value = 16'h1007
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:12 RW ext_state state to be forced into when in accelerated mode, dfs to s0
Reset value is 0x1.
11 RW accel_en accelerated mode enable
Reset value is 0x0.
10 RW debug_clr set 1 to clear debug status. cal state one hot
Reset value is 0x0.
09 RW freqdet_time_msb The MSB for freqdet_time
Reset value is 0x0.
08 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
07:00 RW freqdet_win Frequency detect compare window in lockdet module
Reset value is 0x7.

Return to PLL_CAL_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PLL_CAL_COM_CTL_4 - PLL_CAL_CTL_4
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d124
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d124
Reset Value = 16'h8240
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW halfstep_en enable half_step pll calibration
Reset value is 0x1.
14 RW pll_force_cap_pass_en force cal_valid
Reset value is 0x0.
13 RW pll_force_cap_pass force cal_valid value
Reset value is 0x0.
12 RW cal_pause_en enable pausing to calib process, for debug only
Reset value is 0x0.
11 RW cal_pause_rel release pausing to calib process at posedge, for debug only
Reset value is 0x0.
10 RW cap_delay additional delay to calibration step time
Reset value is 0x0.
09 RW calib_start 1 to start calib, 0 to disable calibration
Reset value is 0x1.
08 RW en_calib_n Enable calibration - active low
Reset value is 0x0.
07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06:00 RW ext_range Externally programmable value for PLL_RANGE
Reset value is 0x40.

Return to PLL_CAL_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

PLL_CAL_COM_CTL_5 - PLL_CAL_CTL_5
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d125
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d125
Reset Value = 16'h8160
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW pll_seq_start To start the pll sequence. For debug only, use core_dp_s/h_rstb to re-start PLL calibration
Reset value is 0x1.
14 RW lkdt_pause_en Enable pausing for Frequency detect, for debug only
Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.
12 RW vco_rst_en Enable PLL reset when PLL is in start state. For debug only, use core_dp_s/h_rstb to re-start PLL calibration
Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x1.

Reset value is 0x3.

Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW pllforce_fdone_en Force Frequency detect
Reset value is 0x0.

RX_CKRST_CTRL_RX_LANE_DEBUG_RESET_CONTROL - RX_LANE_DEBUG_RESET_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d164
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d164
Reset Value = 16'h0003
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW sigdet_dp_rstb_en If asserted by writing to 1'b1 then lane datapath reset will also reset the sigdet filetr logic alomg with lane register reset.
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW ln_rx_dp_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset for RX datapath. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the RX datapath for a lane.
This is a debug only register and it is not handled by FW-HW handshake
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RW ln_rx_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset for RX datapath and registers. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the RX registers and datapath for a lane.
This is a debug only register and it is not handled by FW-HW handshake
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to RX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RX_CKRST_CTRL_RX_CLOCK_N_RESET_DEBUG_CONTROL - RX_CLOCK_N_RESET_DEBUG_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d167
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d167
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04 RW pmd_rx_clk_vld_frc_val pmd_rx_clk_vld core output pin force value.
Reset value is 0x0.
03 RW pmd_rx_clk_vld_frc pmd_rx_clk_vld core output pin force.
Reset value is 0x0.
02 RW ln_rx_s_comclk_frc_on Mux control for selection of comclk for RX Lane clocks by force.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will select the comclk for the RX lane clocks. This is a debug bit and should be used only for recovery from a dead AFE lane clock. Use of this bit with an active AFE clock can cause clock glitches.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_rx_clk_vld to 1'b0 while ln_rx_s_comclk_frc_on is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_rx_clk_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW ln_rx_s_comclk_sel Mux control for selection of comclk for RX Lane clocks.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will select the comclk for the lane clocks.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_rx_clk_vld to 1'b0 while ln_rx_s_comclk_sel is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_rx_clk_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW ln_rx_s_clkgate_frc_on RX Active High Lane clock gator enable. If 1'1b1 then rx lane clock will be gated off. It does not affect the rclk going
to RMIC block so rx lane based registers can still be readable but not writable.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_rx_clk_vld to 1'b0 while rx_s_clkgate_frc_on is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_rx_clk_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to RX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RX_CKRST_CTRL_RX_PMD_LANE_MODE_STATUS - RX_PMD_LANE_MODE_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d168
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d168
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO pmd_lane_mode This indicates the status of the core input pin pmd_lane_mode. 
This is driven from PCS and used for communication between PCS and PMD Micro code.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to RX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d16c
Reset Value = 16'h0002
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RO afe_rx_reset Indicates the status of the afe_rx_reset signal to the AFE after frc/frc_val mux.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RO afe_rx_pwrdn Indicates the status of the afe_rx_pwrdn signal to the AFE after frc/frc_val mux.
Reset value is 0x0.

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_LANE_CLK_RESET_N_POWERDOWN_CONTROL - TX_LANE_CLK_RESET_N_POWERDOWN_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d171
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d171
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW afe_tx_reset_deassert AFE TX Lane reset control. This register will be reset upon POR reg/pin or lane reset reg/pin. Lower priority than the afe_tx_reset_frc/frc_val and  afe_txclk_reset_frc/frc_val option.
1 - AFE TX Lane txclk_reset/tx_reset pins will be forcefully de-asserted irrespective of core/lane datapath pin/reg resets asserted.
     This bit must be set to 1'b1 for TX_Disable all 1s/0s mode to allow TX AFE to transmit the all 1s/0s data.
0 - AFE TX Lane txclk_reset/tx_reset pins will be asserted if core/lane pin/reg resets are asserted.
Reset value is 0x0.
14:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW ln_tx_s_pwrdn Active High Power Down control for TX Lane.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will power down the TX Lane.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_LANE_AFE_RESET_PWRDWN_CONTROL_CONTROL - TX_LANE_AFE_RESET_PWRDWN_CONTROL_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d172
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d172
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:06 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
05 RW afe_txclk_reset_frc_val AFE TXCLK Lane reset force value.
Reset value is 0x0.
04 RW afe_txclk_reset_frc AFE TXCLK Lane reset force.
Reset value is 0x0.
03 RW afe_tx_reset_frc_val AFE TX Lane reset force value.
Reset value is 0x0.
02 RW afe_tx_reset_frc AFE TX Lane reset force.
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW afe_tx_pwrdn_frc_val AFE TX Lane powerdown force value.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW afe_tx_pwrdn_frc AFE TX Lane powerdown force.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_LANE_RESET_N_PWRDN_PIN_KILL_CONTROL - TX_LANE_RESET_N_PWRDN_PIN_KILL_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d173
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d173
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription

Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_LANE_DEBUG_RESET_CONTROL - TX_LANE_DEBUG_RESET_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d174
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d174
Reset Value = 16'h0003
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW ln_tx_dp_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset for TX datapath. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the TX datapath for a lane.
This is a debug only register and it is not handled by FW-HW handshake
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RW ln_tx_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset for TX datapath and registers. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the TX registers and datapath for a lane.
This is a debug only register and it is not handled by FW-HW handshake
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_CLOCK_N_RESET_DEBUG_CONTROL - TX_CLOCK_N_RESET_DEBUG_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d177
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d177
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04 RW pmd_tx_clk_vld_frc_val pmd_tx_clk_vld core output pin force value.
Reset value is 0x0.
03 RW pmd_tx_clk_vld_frc pmd_tx_clk_vld core output pin force.
Reset value is 0x0.
02 RW ln_tx_s_comclk_frc_on Mux control for selection of comclk for TX Lane clocks by force.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will select the comclk for the TX lane clocks. This is a debug bit and should be used only for recovery from a dead AFE lane clock. Use of this bit with an active AFE clock can cause clock glitches.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_tx_clk_vld to 1'b0 while tx_s_comclk_frc_on is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_tx_clk_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RW ln_tx_s_comclk_sel Mux control for selection of comclk for TX Lane clocks.
If asserted by writing to 1'b1 will select the comclk for the lane clocks.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_tx_clk_vld to 1'b0 while tx_s_comclk_sel is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_tx_clk_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW ln_tx_s_clkgate_frc_on TX Active High Lane clock gator enable. If 1'1b1 then tx lane clock will be gated off. It does not affect the tclk going
to RMIC block so tx lane based registers can still be readable but not writable.
" It is recommended for user to force pmd_tx_clk_vld to 1'b0 while tx_s_clkgate_frc_on is asserted to 1'b1
by using pmd_tx_clk_vld_frc/frc_val registers.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_AFE_RESET_PWRDN_OSR_MODE_PIN_STATUS - TX_AFE_RESET_PWRDN_OSR_MODE_PIN_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d17c
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d17c
Reset Value = 16'h0006
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RO afe_txclk_reset Indicates the status of the afe_txclk_reset signal to the AFE after frc/frc_val mux.
Reset value is 0x1.
01 RO afe_tx_reset Indicates the status of the afe_tx_reset signal to the AFE after frc/frc_val mux.
Reset value is 0x1.
00 RO afe_tx_pwrdn Indicates the status of the afe_tx_pwrdn signal to the AFE after frc/frc_val mux.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TX_CKRST_CTRL_TX_CLOCK_N_RESET_MISC_CONTROL - TX_CLOCK_N_RESET_MISC_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d17d
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d17d
Reset Value = 16'h0001
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW tx_pi_loop_filter_stable This register bit is ANDed with pmd_tx_clk_vld before frc/frc_val mux. This register will be controlled by the firmware when TX_PI is enabled.
When TX_PI is enabled then this register will be written to 1'b0 while TX_PI is acquiring the lock with the source clock and will be written to 1'b1 by firmware
to indicate that clocks are locked. It indicates to chip level via pmd_tx_clk_vld to reset any datapath FIFOs and come out of reset when TX clock is stable.
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to TX_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_OSR_MODE_CONTROL - RXCOM_OSR_MODE_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d180
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d180
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW rx_osr_mode_frc oversample (OS) mode force. Setting this bit will allow the register value to be used for OS mode.
Othersise, the pin input values are used for OS mode
Reset value is 0x0.
14:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03:00 RW rx_osr_mode_frc_val oversample (OS) mode Decoding of this register is as follows.
    OSX1          4'd0       
    OSX2          4'd1       
    OSX3          4'd2       
    OSX3P3        4'd3       
    OSX4          4'd4       
    OSX5          4'd5       
    OSX7P5        4'd6       
    OSX8          4'd7       
    OSX8P25       4'd8       
    OSX10         4'd9       
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_LANE_CLK_RESET_N_POWERDOWN_CONTROL - RXCOM_LANE_CLK_RESET_N_POWERDOWN_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d181
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d181
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW rx_ln_dp_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset for datapath. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the datapath for a lane.
This soft reset is equivalent to the hard reset input pin pmd_ln_dp_h_rstb_i.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d183

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_UC_ACK_LANE_CONTROL - RXCOM_UC_ACK_LANE_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d185
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d185
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 SC rx_uc_ack_lane_dp_reset uC will write this to 1 to acknowledge a reset event after seeing "lane_dp_reset_coccured".
Reset value is 0x0.
00 SC rx_uc_ack_lane_cfg_done uC will write this to 1 to indicate it's configuration of the lane is complete. Writing to 1'b1 will 
should release internal hold on lane_dp_reset, only if lane_dp_reset_state is 3'b001.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_LANE_REG_RESET_OCCURRED_CONTROL - RXCOM_LANE_REG_RESET_OCCURRED_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d186
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d186
Reset Value = 16'h0001
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW rx_lane_reg_reset_occurred Set to 1'b1 upon lane level register reset and remains so until cleared by register write from uC.
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_LANE_DP_RESET_STATE_STATUS - RXCOM_LANE_DP_RESET_STATE_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d189
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d189
Reset Value = 16'h0007
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02:00 RO rx_lane_dp_reset_state Bit 2: lane_dp_reset_active   : Set to 1'b1 whenenver lane_dp_reset is currently requested through any register or pin controls. 
Bit 1: lane_dp_reset_occurred : Set to 1'b1 whenenver lane_dp_reset is currently requested through any register or pin controls and is latched high. 
Bit 0: lane_dp_reset_held     : Set to 1'b1 whenenver lane_dp_reset is internally held. Cleared to 1'b0, only if lane_dp_reset_state==001 and uc_ack_lane_cfg_done == 1.
Reset value is 0x7.

Return to RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_MULTICAST_MASK_CONTROL - RXCOM_MULTICAST_MASK_CONTROL

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d18a
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 WO rx_multicast_mask_control This masks the lane from a broadcast or multicast write operation.
Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.
03:00 RO rx_osr_mode OSR Mode status after the mux.
OSR Mode status after the osr_mode_frc/frc_val mux.
Decoding of this register is as follows.
    OSX1          4'd0       
    OSX2          4'd1       
    OSX3          4'd2       
    OSX3P3        4'd3

RXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_RXCOM_AFE_RESET_PWRDN_OSR_MODE_PIN_STATUS - RXCOM_AFE_RESET_PWRDN_OSR_MODE_PIN_STATUS

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d18c
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03:00 RO rx_osr_mode_pin Indicates the status of the pmd_osr_mode input pin.
Decoding of pmd_osr_mode[3:0] pin and osr_mode registers are as follows.
    OSX1          4'd0       
    OSX2          4'd1       
    OSX3          4'd2       
    OSX3P3        4'd3       
    OSX4          4'd4       
    OSX5          4'd5

This soft reset is equivalent to the hard reset input pin pmd_ln_h_rstb_i.
Reset value is 0x1.

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_OSR_MODE_CONTROL - TXCOM_OSR_MODE_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d190
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d190
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW tx_osr_mode_frc oversample (OS) mode force. Setting this bit will allow the register value to be used for OS mode.
Othersise, the pin input values are used for OS mode
Reset value is 0x0.
14:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03:00 RW tx_osr_mode_frc_val oversample (OS) mode Decoding of this register is as follows.
    OSX1          4'd0       
    OSX2          4'd1       
    OSX3          4'd2       
    OSX3P3        4'd3       
    OSX4          4'd4       
    OSX5          4'd5       
    OSX7P5        4'd6       
    OSX8          4'd7       
    OSX8P25       4'd8       
    OSX10         4'd9       
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_LANE_CLK_RESET_N_POWERDOWN_CONTROL - TXCOM_LANE_CLK_RESET_N_POWERDOWN_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d191
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d191
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW tx_ln_dp_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset for datapath. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the datapath for a lane.
This soft reset is equivalent to the hard reset input pin pmd_ln_dp_h_rstb_i.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_LANE_RESET_N_PWRDN_PIN_KILL_CONTROL - TXCOM_LANE_RESET_N_PWRDN_PIN_KILL_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d193
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d193
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW pmd_ln_tx_dp_h_rstb_pkill 1'b1 will disable the pmd_ln_dp_h_rstb input pin.
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RW pmd_ln_tx_h_rstb_pkill 1'b1 will disable the pmd_ln_h_rstb input pin.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_UC_ACK_LANE_CONTROL - TXCOM_UC_ACK_LANE_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d195
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d195
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 SC tx_uc_ack_lane_dp_reset uC will write this to 1 to acknowledge a reset event after seeing "lane_dp_reset_coccured".
Reset value is 0x0.
00 SC tx_uc_ack_lane_cfg_done uC will write this to 1 to indicate it's configuration of the lane is complete. Writing to 1'b1 will 
should release internal hold on lane_dp_reset, only if lane_dp_reset_state is 3'b001.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_LANE_REG_RESET_OCCURRED_CONTROL - TXCOM_LANE_REG_RESET_OCCURRED_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d196
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d196
Reset Value = 16'h0001
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW tx_lane_reg_reset_occurred Set to 1'b1 upon lane level register reset and remains so until cleared by register write from uC.
Reset value is 0x1.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_LANE_DP_RESET_STATE_STATUS - TXCOM_LANE_DP_RESET_STATE_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d199
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d199
Reset Value = 16'h0007
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02:00 RO tx_lane_dp_reset_state Bit 2: lane_dp_reset_active   : Set to 1'b1 whenenver lane_dp_reset is currently requested through any register or pin controls. 
Bit 1: lane_dp_reset_occurred : Set to 1'b1 whenenver lane_dp_reset is currently requested through any register or pin controls and is latched high. 
Bit 0: lane_dp_reset_held     : Set to 1'b1 whenenver lane_dp_reset is internally held. Cleared to 1'b0, only if lane_dp_reset_state==001 and uc_ack_lane_cfg_done == 1.
Reset value is 0x7.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_MULTICAST_MASK_CONTROL - TXCOM_MULTICAST_MASK_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d19a
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d19a
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 WO tx_multicast_mask_control This masks the lane from a broadcast or multicast write operation.
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_OSR_MODE_STATUS_MC_MASK - TXCOM_OSR_MODE_STATUS_MC_MASK

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d19b
Reset Value = 16'h0000

04 RO tx_multicast_mask_control_status Status of multicast mask control for masking lane from multicast write operation.
Reset value is 0x0.
03:00 RO tx_osr_mode OSR Mode status after the mux.
OSR Mode status after the osr_mode_frc/frc_val mux.
Decoding of this register is as follows.
    OSX1          4'd0       
    OSX2          4'd1       
    OSX3          4'd2       
    OSX3P3        4'd3       
    OSX4          4'd4       
    OSX5          4'd5       
    OSX7P5        4'd6       
    OSX8          4'd7       
    OSX8P25       4'd8       
    OSX10         4'd9

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_AFE_RESET_PWRDN_OSR_MODE_PIN_STATUS - TXCOM_AFE_RESET_PWRDN_OSR_MODE_PIN_STATUS
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d19c
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d19c
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03:00 RO tx_osr_mode_pin Indicates the status of the pmd_osr_mode input pin.
Decoding of pmd_osr_mode[3:0] pin and osr_mode registers are as follows.
    OSX1          4'd0       
    OSX2          4'd1       
    OSX3          4'd2       
    OSX3P3        4'd3       
    OSX4          4'd4       
    OSX5          4'd5       
    OSX7P5        4'd6       
    OSX8          4'd7       
    OSX8P25       4'd8       
    OSX10         4'd9

TXCOM_CKRST_CTRL_TXCOM_LN_S_RSTB_CONTROL - TXCOM_LN_S_RSTB_CONTROL
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d19e
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d19e
Reset Value = 16'h0001
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW tx_ln_s_rstb Active Low Lane Soft Reset. If asserted by writing to 1'b0 will reset the registers and datapath for a lane.
This soft reset is equivalent to the hard reset input pin pmd_ln_h_rstb_i.
Reset value is 0x1.

Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d1a5
Reset Value = 16'h1801
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW tx_pi_offset_en Enable TCA automatically generate TX PI offset to account for the 20T port buffers between quad.
Reset value is 0x0.
14 RW tx_pi_offset_dir 0: Increment.
1: Decrement.
Reset value is 0x0.
13:10 RW tx_pi_shift_num TX PI shift step number. Minimum = 1.
Reset value is 0x6.
09:00 RW tx_pi_offset_num TX PI offset step number. Minimum = 1.
Reset value is 0x1.

MICRO_A_COM_CLOCK_CONTROL0 - Clock control registers 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d200
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d200
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW micro_core_clk_en micro core clock enable (m0):
While the micro-code is being loaded into the code RAM, the clock to
micro_core (m0) is normally disabled and a reset is asserted
0 - disabled
1 - enables
Reset value is 0.
00 RW micro_master_clk_en master clock enable:
By default the clock to micro sub-system is disabled and
only the micro control and status registers can be accessed through
the RMIC interface. Setting this field to 1'b1 enable the master clock

0 - disabled
1 - enables
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_RESET_CONTROL0 - Reset control registers 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d201
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d201
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03 RW micro_pram_if_rstb PRAM interface reset :
By default a reset to the PRAM interface is asserted, and 
only the micro control and status registers can be accessed through
the RMIC interface. Setting this field to 1'b1 de-assert a reset to the PRAM interface
0 - asserted
1 - de-asserted
Reset value is 0.
02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW micro_core_rstb micro core reset (m0):
While the micro-code is being loaded into the code RAM, the clock to
micro_core (m0) is normally disabled and a reset is asserted.
Setting this field to 1'b1 de-asserts a reset to the micro.
0 - disabled
1 - enables
Reset value is 0.
00 RW micro_master_rstb master reset :
By default a reset to micro controller sub-system is asserted, and 
only the micro control and status registers can be accessed through
the RMIC interface. Setting this field to 1'b1 de-assert a reset to the micro-subsystem

0 - asserted
1 - de-asserted
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_CONTROL0 - rmi to ahb control registers 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d202
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d202
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:14 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
13 RW micro_autoinc_rdaddr_en Automatic increment read address enable
0 - disabled, micro_ra_rdaddr_lsw and micro_ra_rdaddr_msw field specify the constant address
    where the data is read via the micro_ra_rddata_msw and micro_ra_rddata_lsw fileds
   
1 - enabled, micro_ra_rdaddr_lsw and micro_ra_rdaddr_msw field specify the start address
    where the data is read via the micro_ra_rddata_msw and micro_ra_rddata_lsw fileds
    the address automatically increments based on the micro_ra_rddatasize field after
    the read has been performed
Reset value is 0.
12 RW micro_autoinc_wraddr_en Automatic increment write address enable
0 - disabled, micro_ra_wraddr_lsw and micro_ra_wraddr_msw field specify the constant address
    where the data from the micro_ra_wrdata_msw and micro_ra_wrdata_lsw is written.
   
1 - enabled, micro_ra_wraddr_lsw and micro_ra_wraddr_msw field specify the start address
    where the data from the micro_ra_wrdata_msw and micro_ra_wrdata_lsw is written.
    the address automatically increments based on the micro_ra_wrdatasize field after
    the write has been performed
Reset value is 0.
11:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09:08 RW micro_ra_init Intialize code/data RAM
2'b01: initailize code RAM - write zeroes to all locations
2'b10: initialize data RAM - write zeroes to all loactions
2'b00, 2'b11: ignored
Reset value is 0.
07:06 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
05:04 RW micro_ra_rddatasize read data size select
'd0 : 8-bit   
'd1 : 16-bit  
'd2 : 32-bit  
'd3 : reserved
Reset value is 0.
03:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01:00 RW micro_ra_wrdatasize write data size select
'd0 : 8-bit   
'd1 : 16-bit  
'd2 : 32-bit  
'd3 : reserved
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_STATUS0 - rmi to ahb status registers 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d203
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d203
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RO micro_ra_initdone When this bit is set, it indicate that code/data RAM initialization process is complete
This reamins set until
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_WRADDR_LSW - rmi to ahb write address LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d204
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d204
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW micro_ra_wraddr_lsw These bits are used to generate the lower 16-bits of the address on the AHB-Lite bus during write transactions
bit 0 is not used during 16-bit transactions and
bits[1:0] are not used during 32-bit transactions
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_WRADDR_MSW - rmi to ahb write address MSW (bits 31:16) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d205
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d205
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW micro_ra_wraddr_msw These bits are used to generate the upper 16-bits of the address on the AHB-Lite bus during write transactions
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_WRDATA_LSW - rmi to ahb write data LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d206
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d206
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW micro_ra_wrdata_lsw These bits are used to generate the lower 16-bits of the data on the AHB-Lite bus during write transactions
Write transaction on the AHB-Lite is initiated when this register is written
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_WRDATA_MSW - rmi to ahb write data MSW (bits 31:16) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d207
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d207
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW micro_ra_wrdata_msw These bits are used  to generate the upper 16-bits of the data on the AHB-Lite bus during write transactions
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_RDADDR_LSW - rmi to ahb read address LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d208
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d208
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW micro_ra_rdaddr_lsw These bits are used to generate the lower 16-bits of the address on the AHB-Lite bus during read transactions
bit 0 is not used during 16-bit transactions and
bits[1:0] are not used during 32-bit transactions
Read transaction is initiated on the AHB-Lite when this register is written
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_RDADDR_MSW - rmi to ahb read address MSW (bits 31:16) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d209
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d209
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW micro_ra_rdaddr_msw These bits are used by to generate the upper 16-bits of the address on the AHB-Lite bus during read transactions
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_RDDATA_LSW - rmi to ahb read data LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d20a
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d20a
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO micro_ra_rddata_lsw These are the lower 16-bits of the read data from the AHB-Lite slave device
Read transaction is initiated on the AHB-Lite when this register is read
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_A_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_A_COM_AHB_RDDATA_MSW - rmi to ahb read data MSW (bits 31:16) register

MICRO_A_COM_PRAMIF_CONTROL0 - pram i/f to ahb control registers 0

Physical Address = 32'h0000_d20c
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription

00 RW micro_pramif_en When this bit is set, pram if interface can generate write transactions on the 
AHB-Lite bus, the start address of the transaction is specifield
in the pramif_ahb_wraddr_lsw and pramif_ahb_wraddr_msw fields
Reset value is 0.

Reset Value = 16'h0000

bits[1:0] are not used for 32 transactions
Reset value is 0.
