MICRO_B_COM_RMI_MBOX_CONTROL0 - rmi mailbox control register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d215
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d215
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW micro_gen_intr_rmi_mbox1wr Generate interrupt when micro_rmi_to_micro_mbox1 field is written
0 - disabled
1 - enbled
Reset value is 0.
01 RW micro_gen_intr_rmi_mbox0wr Generate interrupt when micro_rmi_to_micro_mbox0 field is written
0 - disabled
1 - enbled
Reset value is 0.
00 SC micro_rmi_mbox_send_msgin Send message in (to the micro)
This field is set by the RMIC to indicate to the Micro that the message in the
rmi_to_micro_mbox1, and rmi_to_micro_mbox0 regiters is valid.
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_B_COM_RMI_AHB_CONTROL1 - ahb control register 1
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d216
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d216
Reset Value = 16'h0007
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04 RW micro_pmi_hp_ext_ack_timeout_dis pmi_hp_ext_ack_* timeout disable
When micro initates a read/write transctions on the pmi_hp_ext bus
it allows upto 256 clock cycles for pmi_hp_ext_ack_mc/pmi_hp_ext_ack_uc to be asserted
If pmi_hp_ext_ack_* is not received within this time, then it 
1. terminates the current transactions on the pmi_hp_ext bus
2. set the pmi_hp_ext_ack_timeout_status field of the ahbcommon_pmi_hp_status0 register.
3. performs the response error signaling on the micro AHB bus if micro_m0_hresp_en field is set to 1'b1
This timeout period/error reporting/reponse error signaling can be disabled by setting this field i.e.
0: enabled 
1: disabled
Reset value is 0.
03 RW micro_pmi_hp_ack_timeout_dis pmi_hp_ack_* timeout disable
When micro initates a read/write transctions on the pmi_hp bus
it allows upto 256 clock cycles for pmi_hp_ack_mc/pmi_hp_ack_uc to be asserted
If pmi_hp_ack_* is not received within this time, then it 
1. terminates the current transactions on the pmi_hp bus
2. set the pmi_hp_ack_timeout_status field of the ahbcommon_pmi_hp_status0 register.
3. performs the response error signaling on the micro AHB bus when micro_m0_hresp_en field is set to 1'b1
This timeout period/error reporting/reponse error signaling can be disabled by setting this field i.e.
0: enabled 
1: disabled
Reset value is 0.
02 RW micro_sw_pmi_hp_ext_rstb Software reset pmi_hp_ext interface logic
This bit is to initialize the pmi_hp_ext block
0 - reset asserted
1 - reset de-asserted
Reset value is 1.
01 RW micro_sw_pmi_hp_rstb Software reset pmi_hp interface logic
This bit is to initialize the pmi_hp block
0 - reset asserted
1 - reset de-asserted
Reset value is 1.
00 RW micro_m0_hresp_en m0 response error signaling enable
0 - disabled
1 - enabled
Reset value is 1.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_B_COM_RMI_AHB_STATUS1 - ahb status register 1
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d217
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d217
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RO micro_pr_default_slave_error PRAM interface default slave error detected. PRAM interface attempted to access un-used address
1 - error detected - latched high clear on read
0 - no error
Reset value is 0.
01 RO micro_rmi_default_slave_error register interface default slave error detected. Register interface attempted to access un-used address
1 - error detected - latched high clear on read
0 - no error
Reset value is 0.
00 RO micro_m0_default_slave_error m0 default slave error detected. M0 attempted to access un-used address
1 - error detected - latched high clear on read
0 - no error
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_B_COM_RMI_RA_AUTOINC_NXT_WRADDR_LSW - rmi to ahb auto-incremented write address LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d218
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d218
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO micro_ra_autoinc_nxt_wraddr_lsw When the micro_autoinc_wraddr_en is set, then these bits
indicate the lower 16-bits of the address that will be used
"during the next write transaction.
These bits allow address tracking when rmi interface auto address
increment mode is used
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_B_COM_RMI_RA_AUTOINC_NXT_RDADDR_LSW - rmi to ahb auto-incremented read address LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d219
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d219
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO micro_ra_autoinc_nxt_rdaddr_lsw When the micro_autoinc_rdaddr_en is set, then these bits
indicate the lower 16-bits of the address that will be used
"during the next read transaction.
These bits allow address tracking when rmi interface auto address
increment mode is used
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_B_COM_RMI_PR_AUTOINC_NXT_WRADDR_LSW - pram i/f to ahb auto-incremented write address LSW (bits 15:0) register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d21a
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d21a
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO micro_pr_autoinc_nxt_wraddr_lsw When pram interface is used to write to the code/data RAM
then these bits indicate the lower 16-bits of the address that will be used
"during the next write transaction.
These bits allow address tracking
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_B_COM_RMI_PVT_CONTROL0 - rmi pvt temperature control register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d21b
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d21b
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:13 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
12 RW micro_pvt_tempdata_frc temperature dat force enable
When micro_pvt_tempdata_frc field is set to 1'b1 then micro_pvt_tempdata_frcval
field is used to set the temperature value. The temperature value can be read
via micro_pvt_tempdata_rmi field of the pvt_status0 register or
via ahbcommon_pvt_tempdata filed of the ahbcommon_pvt_tempdata register
Reset value is 0.
11:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09:00 RW micro_pvt_tempdata_frcval temperature data force value
When micro_pvt_tempdata_frc field is set to 1'b1 then micro_pvt_tempdata_frcval
field is used to set the temperature value. The temperature value can be read
via micro_pvt_tempdata_rmi field of the pvt_status0 register or
via ahbcommon_pvt_tempdata filed of the ahbcommon_pvt_tempdata register
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_B_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

Return to pcie_gen3: pcie_gen3 Table

MICRO_C_COM_CODE_RAM_ECCCONTROL0 - code ram ecc control 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d220
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d220
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:06 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
05:04 RW micro_ecc_corrupt This field allows the ecc codes to be corrupted for testing.
2'b00 - normal mode 
2'b01 - corrupt the ECC code written into the code/data RAM
2'b10 - corrupt data - add 1 bit data error on the RX side
2'b11 - corrupt data - add 2 bit data error on the RA side
Reset value is 0.
03:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW micro_ecc_frc_disable ecc force disable
0: ECC Enabled  - ECC error code generation determine by the micro_eccg_mode field
                  ECC error checking enabled in hardware mode only
1: ECC Disabled - ECC error codes values written into the RAM set to zero
                  ECC error checking disabled
Reset value is 0.
00 RW micro_eccg_mode ecc code generation mode
0: Hardware mode - ECC code generated by hardware, ECC error checking enabled
1: Software mode - ECC code from the rg_ra_ecc_wrdata field are written into code/data RAM
                   ECC error checking disabled. This mode is only supported
                   when register interface is used
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_CODE_RAM_ECCCONTRO1 - code ram ecc control 1
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d221
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d221
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06:00 RW micro_ra_ecc_wrdata This foield is used to write the ECC codes into the code/data when ECC software modes is enabled
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_CODE_RAM_ECCSTATUS0 - code ram ecc status 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d222
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d222
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
14:00 RO micro_code_ram_ecc_address First ecc error address
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_CODE_RAM_ECCSTATUS1 - code ram ecc status 1
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d223
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d223
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06:00 RO micro_ra_ecc_rddata When the register interface is used to read code/data RAM, then this field can be used
read the ECC codes currently stored in the code/data RAM
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_CODE_RAM_TESTIFCONTROL0 - code ram test interface control 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d224
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d224
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06:00 RW micro_code_ram_tm Test Mode.
  These pins are used to put the instance into various test
  modes that can be used for a number of different purposes
  including extended screening, yield improvement and debug.
  The default mode of the instance is tm='d0. It is 
  highly recommended that the user has control over all the
  tm inputs. All tm inputs are asynchronous. See 
  the Test Modes section of the on line M16SP Web 
  Specification for further details.
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_RAM_CONTROL0 - ram configuration register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d225
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d225
Reset Value = 16'h8401
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW micro_ignore_m0_code_writes Ignore Micro writes to the code portion of the RAM
0 - Allow writes
1 - Ignore writes
Reset value is 1.
14 RW micro_ramclk_noninv Code/Data RAM clock non-inverted
0 - inverted
1 - non-inverted
When non-inverted clock to RAM is used, then a wait state to be inserted during read access.
However, it eliminates the use of both edges of the clock (duty cycle) and makes the timing closer easier
Reset value is 0.
13:08 RW micro_dr_size Data/Code RAM allocation when the micro_dr_looktab_en field is set to 1'b1
The RAM is 36KB and this field can be used to allocate data/code RAM on a 1KB granualarity
6'd0  : Data RAM = 0KB,  Code RAM = 36KB
6'd1  : Data RAM = 1KB,  Code RAM = 35KB
6'd2  : Data RAM = 2KB,  Code RAM = 34KB
...   : Data RAM = .. ,  Code RAM = .. 
...   : Data RAM = .. ,  Code RAM = .. 
6'd35 : Data RAM = 35KB, Code RAM = 1KB
6'd36 : Data RAM = 36KB, Code RAM = 0KB
PLEASE NOTE: the micro in the PMD core does not have any additional RAM to store Code/Data
therfore a value of 0 and 36 should not be used
Reset value is 4.
07:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01 RW micro_protect_fwcode protect firmware code during micro master reset
1 - RAM address, data, chip select and write enable are set to inactive state
    to prevent timing violations from corrupting the contents of the RAM
    If this field is used then the software has to clear this filed before re-starting the micro
0 - RAM address, data, chip select and write enable are set to inactive state
    by using micro_master_rstb register field to prevent timing violations from corrupting the contents of the RAM
Reset value is 0.
00 RW micro_dr_looktab_en Data RAM lookup table enable
1 - Data RAM mapped in the data region by hardware
    starting at address 0x2000_0000 (for software compatibilty)
0 - Data RAM not mapped by hardware
    Firmware defines code/data regiions
Reset value is 1.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_RMI_EXT_INTR_CONTROL0 - rmi external interrupt control register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d226
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d226
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09 RW micro_rmi_m0_systemresetreq_intr_en M0 systemresetreq interrupt enable
When this field is set to 1'b1 then the micro_rmi_m0_systemresetreq_status field of the rmi_ext_intr_status0
registers generate an interrupt on the micro_ext_intr pin
Reset value is 0.
08 RW micro_rmi_m0_lockup_intr_en M0 lockup interrupt enable
When this field is set to 1'b1 then the micro_rmi_m0_lockup_status field of the rmi_ext_intr_status0
registers generate an interrupt on the micro_ext_intr pin
Reset value is 0.
07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06 RW micro_rmi_ecc_multirow_err_intr_en ECC error on multiple row detect interrupt enable
When this field is set to 1'b1 then the micro_rmi_ecc_multirow_err_status field of the rmi_ext_intr_status0
registers generate an interrupt on the micro_ext_intr pin
Reset value is 0.
05 RW micro_rmi_ecc_uncorr_err_intr_en ECC 2 bit un-correctable error detect interrupt enable
When this field is set to 1'b1 then the micro_rmi_ecc_uncorr_err_status field of the rmi_ext_intr_status0
registers generate an interrupt on the micro_ext_intr pin
Reset value is 0.
04 RW micro_rmi_ecc_corr_err_intr_en ECC 1 bit correctable error detect interrupt enable
When this field is set to 1'b1 then the micro_rmi_ecc_corr_err_status field of the rmi_ext_intr_status0
registers generate an interrupt on the micro_ext_intr pin
Reset value is 0.
03:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW micro_rmi_mbox_msgout_intr_en Message out (from Micro) interrupt enable
When this field is set to 1'b1 then the micro_rmi_mbox_msgout_status field of the rmi_ext_intr_status0
registers generate an interrupt on the micro_ext_intr pin
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_RMI_EXT_INTR_STATUS0 - rmi external interrupt status register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d227
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d227
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:10 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
09 RO micro_rmi_m0_systemresetreq_status M0 systemresetreq status
This field indicates the status of the M0 "systemresetreq" signal
Reset value is 0.
08 RO micro_rmi_m0_lockup_status M0 lockup status
This field indicates the status of the M0 "lockup" signal
Reset value is 0.
07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06 RO micro_rmi_ecc_multirow_err_status ECC error on multiple row detected  status
This field is set to 1'b1 when the ECC logic detects correctable or uncorrecatble errors on multiple rows.
This bits remain remains set until this register is read
Reset value is 0.
05 RO micro_rmi_ecc_uncorr_err_status ECC 2 bit un-correctable error detected status
This field is set to 1'b1 when the ECC logic detects one bit un-correctable error.
This bits remain remains set until this register is read
Reset value is 0.
04 RO micro_rmi_ecc_corr_err_status ECC 1 bit correctable error detected status
This field is set to 1'b1 when the ECC logic detects one bit correctable error.
This bits remain remains set until this register is read
Reset value is 0.
03:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RO micro_rmi_mbox_msgout_status Message out (from Micro) status
This field is set to 1'b1 when the RMIC receives a message from the Micro.
It indicates to the RMIC that the message on the micro_to_rmi_mbox3,
micro_to_rmi_mbox2, micro_to_rmi_mbox1 and micro_to_rmi_mbox0 registers is valid
This bits remain remains set until this register is read
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_RMI_PMI_IF_CONTROL0 - pmi interface control register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d228
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d228
Reset Value = 16'h0101
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:11 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
10 RW micro_pmi_hp_ext_fast_bktobk_en pmi_hp_ext interface fast back to back enable
1 - skip over some of the states in the fsm during back to back transition
0 - state transitions as in f28
Reset value is 0.
09 RW micro_pmi_hp_ext_fast_dual_meta_ff_en pmi_hp_ext interface fast dual meta flops enable
1 - use both the rising and falling edges of the clock for dual meta flops
0 - use only the rising edges of the clock for dual meta flops
Reset value is 0.
08 RW micro_pmi_hp_ext_fast_read_en pmi hp ext interface fast read enable
1 - use pmi_hp_ext_read_vld during read
0 - use pmi_hp_ext_ack during read
Reset value is 1.
07:03 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
02 RW micro_pmi_hp_fast_bktobk_en pmi hp interface fast back to back enable
1 - skip over some of the states in the fsm during back to back transition
0 - state transitions as in f28
Reset value is 0.
01 RW micro_pmi_hp_fast_dual_meta_ff_en pmi hp interface fast dual meta flops enable
1 - use both the rising and falling edges of the clock for dual meta flops
0 - use only the rising edges of the clock for dual meta flops
Reset value is 0.
00 RW micro_pmi_hp_fast_read_en pmi hp interface fast read enable
1 - use pmi_hp_read_vld during read
0 - use pmi_hp_ack during read
Reset value is 1.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_C_COM_RMI_SILICON_DEBUG_CONTROL0 - Silicon debug control register 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d229
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d229
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:02 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
01:00 RW micro_silicon_debug_status_mux_sel This field is used to select the data to be muxed to rmi_silicon_debug_status0 registers 
0 - register interface - {5'd0, init_req,  wraddr_changed,  write_req,
                          rdaddr_changed, read_req, ra_state[1:0],
                          1'b0, ra_his_state[2:0]}
1 - pram interface     - {2'b00, pif_state_status[1:0], pif_his_state_status[3:0],
                          pr_hready, pr_cr_chipsel, pr_state[1:0], 1'b0,
                          pr_his_state[2:0]};
2 - pmi_hp interface   - {1'b0, pmi_state[2:0], 4'h0, pmi_his_state[7:0]}
3 - pmi_hp_ext interface   - {1'b0, pmi_state[2:0], 4'h0, pmi_his_state[7:0]}
Reset value is 0.

Return to MICRO_C_COM: common register block for all lanes within each Micro Top Table

Address Offset = 32'h0000_d22a
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d22a
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RO micro_silicon_debug_status_muxed_data Muxed status data is made avaialable on this field. 
micro_silicon_debug_status_mux_sel is used to select the data source
Reset value is 0.

MICRO_INFO_COM_EVAL_STAT - Equalization Status for all lanes
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d231
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d231
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RO err_clr3 Indicates Invalid Request was processed
Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
14 RO err_clr2 Indicates Invalid Request was processed
Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
13 RO err_clr1 Indicates Invalid Request was processed
Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
12 RO err_clr0 Indicates Invalid Request was processed
Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
11 RO eq_done_3 Indicates Equalization is complete and assert Phy_Status
  Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
10 RO eq_done_2 Indicates Equalization is complete and assert Phy_Status
  Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
09 RO eq_done_1 Indicates Equalization is complete and assert Phy_Status
  Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
08 RO eq_done_0 Indicates Equalization is complete and assert Phy_Status
  Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
07 RO eval_err_3 Indicates last Equalization was out of range
  Cleared when Invalid Request has been processed
Reset value is 0x0.
06 RO eval_err_2 Indicates last Equalization was out of range
  Cleared when Invalid Request has been processed
Reset value is 0x0.
05 RO eval_err_1 Indicates last Equalization was out of range
  Cleared when Invalid Request has been processed
Reset value is 0x0.
04 RO eval_err_0 Indicates last Equalization was out of range
  Cleared when Invalid Request has been processed
Reset value is 0x0.
03 RO eq_eval_3 Indicates request for Equalization
  Cleared when Equalization is complete
Reset value is 0x0.
02 RO eq_eval_2 Indicates request for Equalization
  Cleared when Equalization is complete
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RO eq_eval_1 Indicates request for Equalization
  Cleared when Equalization is complete
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RO eq_eval_0 Indicates request for Equalization
  Cleared when Equalization is complete
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to MICRO_INFO_COM: Status Register for all Lanes within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_CTRL0_UC_CTRL0 - MicroController Gen3 Ready Bit
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d240
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d240
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW uc_gen3_rdy Once uC is released from reset, this bit will indicate
ready for Gen3, set by uC
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to MICRO_CTRL0: Control Registers [One Copy Per Lane] within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_CTRL0_UC_CTRL1 - MicroController Feeback Direction Change and Figure of Merit Control Register
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d241
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d241
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 SC eval_done When asserted indicates uC is done calculating
fdbk_dir_chg and/or fig_merit and assert Phy Status
This bit will be cleared when eq_eval is asserted
Reset value is 0x0.
14 SC eval_err_clr When asserted indicates the uC's last evaluation
was incorrect and this invalid request was
processed and is cleared
Reset value is 0x0.
13:08 RW fdbk_dir_chg tbd
Reset value is 0x0.
07:00 RW fig_merit tbd
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to MICRO_CTRL0: Control Registers [One Copy Per Lane] within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_CTRL0_UC_CTRL2 - MicroController Gen1/Gen2 Peaking Filter Control
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d242
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d242
Reset Value = 16'h0707
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:13 RW pf2_lowp_ctrl_g2 Low Freq PF, low pass. Gray code
Reset value is 0x0.
12 RW rx_pf_hiz_g2 Enable hiz mode for peaking filter, shift the boost peak to a higher freq.
Reset value is 0x0.
11:08 RW pf_ctrl_g2 Init value of OS Gen 2 rate peaking filter. Gray code.
Reset value is 0x7.
07:05 RW pf2_lowp_ctrl_g1 Low Freq PF, low pass. Gray code
Reset value is 0x0.
04 RW rx_pf_hiz_g1 Enable hiz mode for peaking filter, shift the boost peak to a higher freq.
Reset value is 0x0.
03:00 RW pf_ctrl_g1 Init value of OS Gen 2 rate peaking filter. Gray code.
Reset value is 0x7.

Return to MICRO_CTRL0: Control Registers [One Copy Per Lane] within each Micro Top Table

MICRO_CTRL0_UC_EVAL_STAT - Equalization Status
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d247
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d247
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:04 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
03 RO err_clr Indicates Invalid Request was processed
Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
02 RO eq_done Indicates Equalization is complete and assert Phy_Status
  Cleared on new equalization request
Reset value is 0x0.
01 RO eval_err Indicates last Equalization was out of range
  Cleared when Invalid Request has been processed
Reset value is 0x0.
00 RO eq_eval Indicates request for Equalization
  Cleared when Equalization is complete
Reset value is 0x0.

MICRO_DBG_STATUS0 - System Status 0
Address Offset = 32'h0000_d250
Physical Address = 32'h0000_d250
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RO (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:14 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
13:12 RO rate_sel Rate Select: 00=Gen1, 01=Gen2, 10=Gen3
Reset value is 0x0.
11 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
10:08 RO rx_sigdet 10   9   8
x   x   1 = DSC
x   1   x = MAC
1   x   x = RAW
Reset value is 0x0.
07:05 RO rx_sigdet_st ARM_ST         = 3'h0
PLL_LOCK_ST    = 3'h1
EIEOS_DET_ST   = 3'h2
SIGNAL_ON_ST   = 3'h3
SIGNAL_DROP_ST = 3'h4
WAIT_ST        = 3'h5
Reset value is 0x0.
04:00 RO uc_dbg_dsc_state DSC State - refer to register 0xD01E for description
Reset value is 0x0.

15 RW RxL1Active_frc Force RXL1Active
Reset value is 0x0.
14 RW RxL1Active_frc_val Force RXL1Active value
Reset value is 0x0.
13:10 RW phase_err_offset_G3 Phase Error Offset for non-L0sL1_ACQ_CDR states in gen3 speed. Signed value. Valid range is -8 to 7. This translates to either -8/2 to 7/2 or -8/4 to 7/4, depending on how rg_phase_err_offset_mult_2 is set. By default is is -8/4 to 7/4 adding into VCO reg.
Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0x0.

Reset value is 0xf.

Reset value is 0xf.

05:00 RW fir_pre_extent_5 tx coeff fir_pre_extent_5 when pre_coefficient > 10
Reset value is 0x3f.

Return to TX_COEFF_PRE: per lane register block [One Copy Per Lane] Table

MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM: common register block for all lanes Registers

MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM_MDIO_BRCST_PORT_ADDR - Broadcast Port Address
Address Offset = 32'h0000_ffdc
Physical Address = 32'h0000_ffdc
Reset Value = 16'h001f
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:05 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
04:00 RW mdio_brcst_port_addr Braodcast port address that can be used to broadcast mdio commands
to multiple controllers connected to the same mdio station manager
Reset value is 0x1f.

Return to MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM_MDIO_MMD_SELECT - MMD Select
Address Offset = 32'h0000_ffdd
Physical Address = 32'h0000_ffdd
Reset Value = 16'h404d
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RW mdio_multi_prts_en When set enables multiple prtad functionality.  Each of the lanes'
mmds can be accessed with consecutive PRTADs.  Lane 0 is accessed
with PRTAD_STRAP, lane 1 with PRTAD_STRAP+1, lane 2 with PRTAD_STRAP+2
and lane 3 with PRTAD_STRAP+3.
Reset value is 0.
14 RW mdio_multi_mmds_en When set enables the multiple MMD functionality.  MD_ST is ignored and
each device can be accessed directly with the appropriate CL22 or CL45
protocol.
Reset value is 1.
13:07 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
06 RW mdio_dev_pcs_en When set and mdio_multi_mmds_en=1 then the PCS device=3 registers can be directly
accessed through the MDIO serial data stream.
Reset value is 1.
05 RW mdio_dev_dte_en When set and mdio_multi_mmds_en=1 then the DTE device=5 registers can be directly
accessed through the MDIO serial data stream.
Reset value is 0.
04 RW mdio_dev_phy_en When set and mdio_multi_mmds_en=1 then the PHY device=4 registers can be directly
accessed through the MDIO serial data stream.
Reset value is 0.
03 RW mdio_dev_an_en When set and mdio_multi_mmds_en=1 then the AN device=7 registers can be directly
accessed through the MDIO serial data stream.
Reset value is 1.
02 RW mdio_dev_pmd_en When set and mdio_multi_mmds_en=1 then the PMD device=1 registers can be directly
accessed through the MDIO serial data stream.
Reset value is 1.
01 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
00 RW mdio_dev_cl22_en When set and mdio_multi_mmds_en=1 then CL22 registers can be directly
accessed through the MDIO serial data stream.
Reset value is 1.

Return to MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM_MDIO_AER - AER
Address Offset = 32'h0000_ffde
Physical Address = 32'h0000_ffde
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15:00 RW mdio_aer Provides upper 16-bits of 32-bit address for mdio transactions
Reset value is 0x0.

Return to MDIO_MMDSEL_AER_COM: common register block for all lanes Table

MDIO_BLK_ADDR_COM: common register block for all lanes Registers

AddressRegister Name/Description Bit DescriptionDefault
1514131211109876543210
0xFFDFMDIO_BLK_ADDR_COM_BLK_ADDR
BLK_ADDR
reserved
mdio_blk_addr
reserved
 16'h0000

Return to pcie_gen3: pcie_gen3 Table

MDIO_BLK_ADDR_COM_BLK_ADDR - BLK_ADDR
Address Offset = 32'h0000_ffdf
Physical Address = 32'h0000_ffdf
Reset Value = 16'h0000
Access = RW (16-bit only)
Bit FieldBit Access Field NameDescription
15 RSVD Reserved Reserved bit must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.
14:04 RW mdio_blk_addr Block address (used for clause 22 transactions to get the address bits 14:4)
Reset value is 0x0.
03:00 RSVD Reserved Reserved bits must be written with 0.  A read returns an unknown value.

Return to MDIO_BLK_ADDR_COM: common register block for all lanes Table
